title: scott pilgrim vs. the world
filming_locations: artscape wychwood barns, toronto, ontario, canada
maturity_reasoning: rated pg-13 for stylized violence, sexual content, language and drug references
overview: a young man must defeat his new girlfriend's seven evil exes, who are willing to do anything to prevent her happiness with someone else.
plot_summaries: scott pilgrim plays in a band which aspires to success. he dates knives chau, a high-school girl five years younger, and he hasn't recovered from being dumped by his former girlfriend, now a success with her own band. when scott falls for ramona flowers, he has trouble breaking up with knives and tries to romance ramona. as if juggling two women wasn't enough, ramona comes with baggage: seven ex-lovers, with each of whom scott must do battle to the death in order to win ramona.

scott pilgrim (michael cera) is an unemployed 23-year-old bass guitarist in an up-and-coming garage rock band who is dating a cute 17-year-old high school girl, knives chau (ellen wong). he is having fun in life and rolling along at a nice even tempo until one day ramona flowers (mary elizabeth winstead) roller-blades into his life. ramona moved to toronto from new york city to find peace and quiet and leave her past behind. no one knows what her past is, but scott will find out very soon as he tries to make ramona his new girlfriend. before scott can begin dating ramona, he must prove himself by defeating the league of her seven exes who controls her love life. they will do anything to get rid of and destroy any new boyfriend ramona may consider. if scott wants to find true love with ramona, he must defeat all seven, before the game is over.
synopsis:
in toronto, scott pilgrim (michael cera), a 22 year old bass guitarist for the band "sex bob-omb", begins dating a 17-year-old high-school student knives chau (ellen wong), much to the disapproval of his friends 22 years old stephen stills (mark webber), 23 years old kim pine (alison pill), 20 years old "young" neil nordegraf (johnny simmons), his roommate 25 years old wallace wells (kieran culkin), and his younger 18 years old sister stacey pilgrim (anna kendrick). knives and scott haven't even kissed each other yet and were far from having sex. they held hands together once and knives got embarrassed. it's been a year since scott was dumped by natalie. wallace is gay and is dating other scott (ben lewis). everyone is worried that scott is now dating a high-school student. julie powers (aubrey plaza) is a 23-year-old worker at a record store.
scott imagines his life to be like a video-game, with every character having their title cards, displaying essential information along with their powers. scott meets an american girl, ramona flowers (mary elizabeth winstead), an american amazon delivery girl, who has been appearing in his dreams, and becomes obsessed with her. julie tells scott that ramona is out of his league. she is the coolest girl in town, has a boyfriend in new york, but had a big fight with him recently. julie says that ramona keeps mentioning a name gideon.
scott loses interest in knives but does not break up with her before pursuing ramona. both wallace and stacey tell scott to break up with knives before going after ramona, but he ignores them. scott orders stuff from amazon so ramona has to come and deliver it. scott asks ramona out on a date, and she accepts else otherwise scott would not sign for the package. they end up in ramona's apartment due to a snowstorm and scott sleeps in her bed, though ramona changes her mind about having sex with scott on their first date. scott invites ramona to the battle of the bands.
scott also receives an email from matthew patel challenging him to a duel. while playing in a battle of the bands sponsored by one "g-man graves" for a record deal, scott is attacked by matthew patel (satya bhabha), who introduces himself as the first of ramona's "evil exes". ramona & patel dated for a week and a half in 7th grade, post which ramona dumped him. scott defeats patel and learns from ramona that, in order for them to date, he must defeat all seven of her evil exes.
ramona and knives were both at the battle of the bands and knives kisses scott in front of ramona. while going home with scott on the bus, ramona admits that she is dating scott and agrees to make out with him. the next day, knives invites scott to her birthday dinner with her parents. knives says that she is in love with scott. scott finally breaks up with knives, who blames ramona and swears to win him back, by becoming more like ramona. scott battles ramona's second evil ex, popular actor and skateboarder lucas lee (chris evans), who he defeats by tricking him into performing a dangerous skateboard grind that causes him to ignite. scott later encounters the third evil ex, todd ingram (brandon routh), who is dating scott's ex-girlfriend, natalie "envy" adams (brie larson). envy is in a band herself and invites scott's band to open the show for them. todd is part of envy's band. todd initially overpowers scott using his psychic vegan abilities but is stripped of his powers by the vegan police after scott tricks him into drinking coffee with half and half cream, allowing scott to defeat him. scott begins to grow upset with ramona over her dating history by the defeat of the fourth ex, roxanne "roxy" richter (mae whitman). ramona had a brief lesbian fling with roxy before she dumped her & made her an "evil ex". when roxy attacks scott, ramona steps in to protect scott and defeat roxy.
scott grows frustrated during the process, and after an outburst regarding ramona's dating history, she breaks up with him. during the second round of the battle of the bands, sex bob-omb faces off against the fifth and sixth evil exes, twin katayanagi brothers kyle (shota saito) and ken (keita saito), earning scott an extra life upon their defeat. during the battle, scott sees ramona together with her seventh evil ex, gideon graves (jason schwartzman), who turns out to be sex bob-omb's sponsor, g-man. the members of sex bob-omb accept gideon's record deal, except for scott, who leaves the band. upon returning home, scott receives a phone call invitation from gideon to his newly opened chaos theater where sex bob-omb is playing, claiming there to be "no hard feelings". scott arrives and challenges gideon to a fight, professing his love for ramona and gaining a sword called the "power of love", which gideon easily destroys. knives then crashes the scene to fight ramona over scott. scott goes to break up the girls' fight, only to accidentally reveal that he cheated on them with each other before he is killed by gideon. ramona visits scott in limbo and apologizes for getting him involved in her affairs, revealing that gideon had planted a mind control device in the back of her head. scott realizes he still has an extra life and uses it to return to life at the moment in time when gideon first called him. scott reenters the chaos theater where he makes peace with his friends and challenges gideon again, stating he is fighting for himself and gaining the much stronger "power of self-respect" sword with which he strikes down gideon. he then apologizes to ramona and knives for cheating on them, but gideon interferes and knocks down ramona, leading scott and knives to team up and defeat him. free from gideon's control, ramona prepares to leave, but knives accepts that her relationship with scott is over and encourages him to follow ramona. he does, and the two start their relationship anew.

plot_events_metadata.plot_summary:
In Toronto, 22-year-old Scott Pilgrim is the bass player for garage band Sex Bob-omb and is dating 17-year-old high-schooler Knives Chau while still pining over ex Natalie "Envy" Adams. Scott repeatedly dreams about Ramona Flowers, an American delivery girl who recently moved to Toronto. After engineering repeated Amazon deliveries so Ramona must meet him, Scott asks her out and they begin seeing each other. At the Battle of the Bands, Matthew Patel appears, reveals himself as Ramona's first "evil ex," and attacks Scott; Scott defeats him and Ramona tells Scott that to date her he must defeat her seven evil exes.

Scott delays breaking up with Knives, then eventually ends the relationship; Knives vows to win him back. Lucas Lee, a famous actor/skateboarder and Ramona's second evil ex, challenges Scott; during a film shoot Lucas is tricked into a dangerous skateboard stunt and Scott defeats him. The third evil ex, Todd Ingram, is the bassist for Envy Adams' new band and has psychic "vegan" powers; Todd initially overpowers Scott, but after Scott tricks Todd into drinking coffee with cream and the Vegan Police revoke Todd's powers, Scott defeats him. Roxanne "Roxy" Richter, Ramona's fourth evil ex and a brief lesbian fling, attacks Scott; Ramona intervenes and helps Scott subdue Roxy. Ramona and Scott's relationship strains; after Scott lashes out about her past she breaks up with him.

At a second Battle of the Bands, Scott fights twin techno-producers the Katayanagi Brothers (evil exes five and six) and defeats them, earning an extra life. Sex Bob-omb accepts a record deal offered by Gideon Graves (the seventh evil ex) and his company; Scott refuses and leaves the band. Gideon, revealed as the band's sponsor "G-Man Graves," invites Sex Bob-omb to the Chaos Theatre. At the Chaos Theatre Gideon bests Scott in combat, then uses a device in Ramona's backpack to control her; Knives crashes the show and fights Ramona over Scott. Scott tries to stop the fight, accidentally admitting he dated both girls simultaneously, and Gideon kills Scott. In limbo Ramona apologizes and reveals Gideon planted a subcutaneous mind-control component in her; Scott uses an unused extra life to revive at the moment Gideon first called him.

Back at the Chaos Theatre Scott makes amends with his friends, then confronts Gideon again. He declares he fights for himself and acquires the "power of self-respect" sword, which can defeat Gideon; Gideon shatters Scott's earlier "power of love" sword. During the final fight Ramona is freed from Gideon's control; Scott, Ramona and Knives briefly team up and together they defeat Gideon. Gideon dies; Ramona prepares to leave but Knives accepts that Scott and Ramona belong together and encourages Scott to follow Ramona. Scott and Ramona reconcile and begin their relationship anew, while Sex Bob-omb continues performing with renewed purpose.
plot_events_metadata.setting: Modern-day Toronto, primarily music venues and Ramona's apartment

major_characters.name: Scott Pilgrim
major_characters.description: 22-year-old unemployed bass guitarist of Sex Bob-omb who daydreams in video-game terms.
major_characters.primary_motivations: Win Ramona Flowers' love by defeating her seven evil exes so he can be in a real relationship.

major_characters.name: Ramona Flowers
major_characters.description: American delivery girl living in Toronto with a mysterious past and seven powerful exes.
major_characters.primary_motivations: Find peace and a fresh start in Toronto while escaping control from her past, particularly Gideon.

major_characters.name: Gideon Graves
major_characters.description: Record executive and the seventh, most powerful of Ramona's evil exes who sponsors Sex Bob-omb.
major_characters.primary_motivations: Control Ramona and dominate her love life and the Toronto music scene through manipulation and power.

major_characters.name: Knives Chau
major_characters.description: 17-year-old high-school girl who dates Scott before he pursues Ramona.
major_characters.primary_motivations: Hold onto her relationship with Scott and later accept his growth so he can pursue what he truly wants.

plot_analysis_metadata.core_engine: Prove worth by defeating romantic rivals
plot_analysis_metadata.generalized_plot_overview: A directionless young man courts a mysterious new woman who demands he defeat her seven 'evil exes' to be with her; he fights escalating, stylized battles, faces his immaturity, and must choose accountability over avoidance. By confronting rivals and a manipulative final antagonist he gains self-respect, makes amends, and rebuilds a healthier relationship.

reception_summary: reviewers say 'scott pilgrim vs. the world' is a visually imaginative film blending video games, comic books, and pop culture. praised for its unique style, fast-paced editing, and quirky humor, the film offers creative storytelling and an energetic soundtrack. however, some find the plot repetitive and characters unlikable. its niche appeal caters mainly to geek culture fans, though many appreciate its originality and entertainment value despite mixed opinions.

debug_plot_summaries: scott pilgrim plays in a band which aspires to success. he dates knives chau, a high-school girl five years younger, and he hasn't recovered from being dumped by his former girlfriend, now a success with her own band. when scott falls for ramona flowers, he has trouble breaking up with knives and tries to romance ramona. as if juggling two women wasn't enough, ramona comes with baggage: seven ex-lovers, with each of whom scott must do battle to the death in order to win ramona.

scott pilgrim (michael cera) is an unemployed 23-year-old bass guitarist in an up-and-coming garage rock band who is dating a cute 17-year-old high school girl, knives chau (ellen wong). he is having fun in life and rolling along at a nice even tempo until one day ramona flowers (mary elizabeth winstead) roller-blades into his life. ramona moved to toronto from new york city to find peace and quiet and leave her past behind. no one knows what her past is, but scott will find out very soon as he tries to make ramona his new girlfriend. before scott can begin dating ramona, he must prove himself by defeating the league of her seven exes who controls her love life. they will do anything to get rid of and destroy any new boyfriend ramona may consider. if scott wants to find true love with ramona, he must defeat all seven, before the game is over.

title: the naked gun: from the files of police squad!
original_title: the naked gun: from the files of police squad!
filming_locations: dodger stadium - 1000 vin scully avenue, chavez ravine, elysian park, los angeles, california, usa
overview: incompetent police detective frank drebin must foil an attempt to assassinate queen elizabeth ii.
plot_summaries: a rerun of many of the gags from the television series police squad! (1982). an airplane! (1980)-type spoof, this time with the an incompetent lieutenant frank drebin, who always "gets his man". visual gags come thick and fast, and it's impossible to catch them all with one viewing. the plot: queen elizabeth ii of england is coming to town, and vincent ludwig has plans to assassinate her using a brainwashed baseball player.

lieutenant frank drebin and his police squad! are put in charge of security when it's announced that queen elizabeth ii will be visiting los angeles, california. frank visits the event organizer, rich developer vincent ludwig, who is also reputed to be a criminal mastermind, who may also be responsible for putting one of drebin's men, nordberg, in the hospital. stopping the plot to assassinate the queen, solving the attack on nordberg, and romancing jane spencer are all in a day's work for drebin, along with several laughs along the way.

with the imminent arrival of her majesty the queen elizabeth ii to los angeles, the bumbling police lieutenant, frank drebin, has his work cut out for him. already entangled in a difficult case of heroin smuggling and the brutal murder attempt of a fellow officer, drebin will find himself under the spell of jane spencer--the sensuous assistant of the ultra-suave criminal mastermind, vincent ludwig. someone has set his sights on assassinating the prestigious visitor in front of thousands of spectators during an important baseball game; however, not on drebin's watch. can drebin and his naked gun save the day?

lieutenant frank drebin is a clumsy police detective of police squad!, a division of the los angeles police department. frank returns home to los angeles from a mission in beirut, when his partner and best friend, detective nordberg is gunned down in a undercover operation. frank's investigation into nordberg's attempted murder leads frank to become suspicious of well-respected businessman vincent ludwig, and discovers ludwig plans to brainwash a baseball player with mind controlling device, and assassinate queen elizabeth ii, who is visiting los angeles on her american tour.
synopsis: in beirut, lebanon, a gang of anti-american leaders including ayatollah khomeini, mikhail gorbachev, yasser arafat, muammar gaddafi, fidel castro, and idi amin meet to plan the ultimate terrorist act against the united states. the man who is later shown to be pahpshmir is also present. frank drebin (leslie nielsen) has been posing undercover as a waiter; he beats up all the attendees, revealing that gorbachev is an impostor and various other shocking facts about them in the process, and warns them that they will never attack america as long as he is on the job. in los angeles, officer nordberg (o.j. simpson) unsuccessfully attempts to bust a heroin drug operation at the docks organized by vincent ludwig (ricardo montalban) and is shot numerous times by ludwig's henchmen. after being briefed on the case by his colleague and friend, captain ed hocken (george kennedy), frank visits nordberg in the hospital. nordberg can provide only a few cryptic clues, including a picture of ludwig's ship on which the deal had been organized. frank later meets with wacky police scientist named ted olsen (ed williams), who has invented a cuff-link that shoots out a tiny dart which renders the victim unconscious, promptly testing it on hocken. while discussing nordberg's case, it is revealed that the police force suspects nordberg to be corrupt and involved in drug dealings. hocken gives drebin 24 hours to clear nordberg's name. pahpshmir meets with ludwig, who announces that he will assassinate queen elizabeth ii (jeannette charles) for $20 million. with his beeper used as an acoustic trigger, ludwig demonstrates that he has a way of turning anyone into an unknowing assassin via the post-hypnotic suggestion. later, drebin visits ludwig in his office and inadvertently lets slip the information that nordberg is still alive, which results in an assassination attempt by a hypnotized physician. frank chases the assassin in a commandeered teen driving school car until the luckless fugitive crashes the car into a gasoline truck, a u.s. army missile transporter, and-riding astride the missile-a fireworks factory. as drebin works on the case, he meets and falls in love with ludwig's assistant, jane spencer (priscilla presley). it is eventually revealed that she knows nothing about ludwig's plot, and after jane learns of her employer's villainy, she helps frank with his investigation. however, things go awry as frank breaks into ludwig's office to get crucial information. in the process of finding that information, frank ends up setting a fire that completely destroys ludwig's office. later, to make things worse, after frank accidentally sees ludwig appear to make an outright assassination attempt on the queen at a reception, frank ends up causing more trouble and is removed from police squad. during the queen's visit to a california angels baseball game, jane tells frank that one of the team's players will conduct the assassination. while hiding from his fellow policemen, who are now under orders to arrest him, frank first attempts to disguise himself as the opera singer enrico pallazzo, brutally mangling the u.s. national anthem along the way, and manages to secure the position of the home plate umpire and begins calling the game while simultaneously frisking all players for weapons. finally, realizing that he is running out of time, frank goes to great lengths to delay the game, ultimately resorting to interfering with the play to the ire of the managers of the mariners and the angels. ludwig activates his 'sleeper', the right-fielder for the angels, reggie jackson. jane alerts frank, who chases after jackson. jackson catches and tackles him, inadvertently triggering a bench-clearing brawl between the angels and their opponent, the seattle mariners, while ludwig takes jane to the top of the stadium at gunpoint. during the brawl, jackson emerges from the pile and points his gun at the queen. however, frank fires one of ted's cuff-link darts to incapacitate jackson, but accidentally hits a fat woman in the upper mezzanine instead. still, frank manages to save the queen's life, because the dazed fat woman falls on top of jackson, knocking him out. frank later moves through the crowd to the top of the stadium, where ludwig holds jane at gunpoint. frank shot ludwig with the other cuff-link dart, causing ludwig to stagger and fall several stories over the stadium's railing. the usc marching band tromps over ludwig's steamroller-flattened body, triggering his beeper and thus activating jane's own post-hypnotic suggestion, which compels her to kill frank with ludwig's gun. frank uses his reverse psychology to try and break jane's hypnotized state by openly professing his feelings for her, and gives her an engagement ring, after which jane is freed from ludwig's hypnosis and finally accepts frank's marriage proposal. frank's speech is broadcast on the stadium screen, causing the teams and the audience to burst into tears, fall into each other's arms and make up. afterwards, frank and jane meet mayor barkley (nancy marchand), who reinstates frank back to police squad, and nordberg congratulates him. nordberg, while still on wheelchair-bound, seems much better until frank pats nordberg on the back, accidentally sending him toppling down the aisle and up over the railing of the stadium's upper deck.

plot_events_metadata.plot_summary: In Beirut, Lebanon, Lieutenant Frank Drebin (Leslie Nielsen) is undercover as a waiter at a meeting of international terrorists and disrupts the gathering. Back in Los Angeles, Officer Nordberg (O.J. Simpson) attempts to bust a heroin deal at the docks tied to wealthy developer Vincent Ludwig (Ricardo Montalban) and is shot and hospitalized. Captain Ed Hocken (George Kennedy) briefs Drebin and gives him 24 hours to clear suspicions that Nordberg was corrupt. Drebin visits Nordberg in the hospital and later consults eccentric police scientist Ted Olson, who equips Drebin with a cuff-link that fires a tranquilizing dart. Ludvig meets with a foreign agent called Pahpshmir and is contracted to assassinate Queen Elizabeth II during her Los Angeles visit by using a post-hypnotic acoustic trigger to turn someone into an unwitting assassin. Drebin investigates Ludwig, inadvertently alerts Ludwig that Nordberg survived, and survives an assassination attempt by a hypnotized physician, pursuing him through Los Angeles until the assassin crashes spectacularly. Drebin falls for Ludwig’s assistant Jane Spencer (Priscilla Presley); she is initially unaware of Ludwig’s plot but, when she learns of it, begins helping Drebin. Drebin breaks into Ludwig’s office searching for evidence and accidentally burns it down. After a reception where Drebin misinterprets events and is removed from Police Squad, Jane informs him that an Angels baseball player has been hypnotized as the assassin. During the California Angels–Seattle Mariners game at the stadium attended by the Queen, Drebin disguises himself as opera singer Enrico Pallazzo to get access, then becomes the home-plate umpire to frisk players. Ludwig activates his sleeper: right fielder Reggie Jackson, who, during a bench-clearing brawl Drebin provokes, emerges armed and points a gun at the Queen. Drebin fires Olson’s cuff-link dart intended for Jackson but instead hits a spectator; that spectator falls on Jackson, knocking him out and preventing the assassination. Ludwig takes Jane to the top of the stadium and holds her at gunpoint; Drebin climbs up, wounds Ludwig with the second dart, and Ludwig falls over the railing. Ludwig’s beeper triggers Jane’s post-hypnotic suggestion, forcing her to aim at Drebin; Frank publicly professes love and proposes with an engagement ring to break her conditioning, which frees her. The Queen is saved; Drebin is reinstated to Police Squad, Jane accepts his proposal, Nordberg congratulates him but accidentally falls off his wheelchair and over the railing, providing a final comic close.
plot_events_metadata.setting: Modern-day Los Angeles (with opening in Beirut)

major_characters.name: Frank Drebin
major_characters.description: Clumsy LAPD lieutenant in Police Squad tasked with protecting the Queen.
major_characters.primary_motivations: Foil the plot against Queen Elizabeth II, clear Nordberg's name, and win Jane's affection.

major_characters.name: Vincent Ludwig
major_characters.description: Wealthy developer and criminal mastermind planning the assassination.
major_characters.primary_motivations: Assassinate the Queen for hire using mind-control technology to further his power and profit.

major_characters.name: Jane Spencer
major_characters.description: Ludwig's assistant who becomes Drebin's love interest and ally.
major_characters.primary_motivations: Initially loyal employee, then help Drebin stop Ludwig after learning the truth and be with Frank.

major_characters.name: Nordberg
major_characters.description: Drebin's friend and fellow officer who is shot and hospitalized.
major_characters.primary_motivations: Survive the assassination attempt; his shooting drives Drebin's investigation to expose Ludwig.

plot_analysis_metadata.generalized_plot_overview: An incompetent, deadpan detective accidentally uncovers and disrupts a covert assassination scheme against a visiting foreign dignitary, using bungled investigations, slapstick improvisation, and improbable luck to expose conspirators and restore order while winning romantic partnership—highlighting incompetence, accidental heroism, and parody throughout.

characters: policeman at docks - 'please disperse, please disperse.'
city hall official - 'here, you can use my radio mike.'
passerby - 'hey! what's the meaning of this?'
reporter - 'mayor, will there be any additional security officers added to the police force during the queen's visit?'
nurse - 'oh, dr. alford, i have mrs. kepley's chart if you're ready to go over it.'
usher - 'mr. pallazzo, our head usher will be here in two minutes to take you onto the field.'
head usher - 'mr. pallazzo! would you come with me?'
reception_summary: reviewers say 'the naked gun: from the files of police squad!' is a hilarious film with memorable lines and absurd situations that keep audiences entertained. leslie nielsen's deadpan delivery and the supporting cast's performances enhance the humor. however, some viewers find the rapid-fire jokes overwhelming, and a few gags fall flat. despite this, the film's slapstick humor, visual gags, and iconic scenes, such as frank drebin's interactions with queen elizabeth, contribute to its enduring comedic appeal.

stagger and fall several stories over the stadium's railing. the usc marching band tromps over ludwig's steamroller-flattened body, triggering his beeper and thus activating jane's own post-hypnotic suggestion, which compels her to kill frank with ludwig's gun. frank uses his reverse psychology to try and break jane's hypnotized state by openly professing his feelings for her, and gives her an engagement ring, after which jane is freed from ludwig's hypnosis and finally accepts frank's marriage proposal. frank's speech is broadcast on the stadium screen, causing the teams and the audience to burst into tears, fall into each other's arms and make up. afterwards, frank and jane meet mayor barkley (nancy marchand), who reinstates frank back to police squad, and nordberg congratulates him. nordberg, while still on wheelchair-bound, seems much better until frank pats nordberg on the back, accidentally sending him toppling down the aisle and up over the railing of the stadium's upper deck.
debug_plot_summaries: a rerun of many of the gags from the television series police squad! (1982). an airplane! (1980)-type spoof, this time with the an incompetent lieutenant frank drebin, who always "gets his man". visual gags come thick and fast, and it's impossible to catch them all with one viewing. the plot: queen elizabeth ii of england is coming to town, and vincent ludwig has plans to assassinate her using a brainwashed baseball player.

lieutenant frank drebin and his police squad! are put in charge of security when it's announced that queen elizabeth ii will be visiting los angeles, california. frank visits the event organizer, rich developer vincent ludwig, who is also reputed to be a criminal mastermind, who may also be responsible for putting one of drebin's men, nordberg, in the hospital. stopping the plot to assassinate the queen, solving the attack on nordberg, and romancing jane spencer are all in a day's work for drebin, along with several laughs along the way.

with the imminent arrival of her majesty the queen elizabeth ii to los angeles, the bumbling police lieutenant, frank drebin, has his work cut out for him. already entangled in a difficult case of heroin smuggling and the brutal murder attempt of a fellow officer, drebin will find himself under the spell of jane spencer--the sensuous assistant of the ultra-suave criminal mastermind, vincent ludwig. someone has set his sights on assassinating the prestigious visitor in front of thousands of spectators during an important baseball game; however, not on drebin's watch. can drebin and his naked gun save the day?

lieutenant frank drebin is a clumsy police detective of police squad!, a division of the los angeles police department. frank returns home to los angeles from a mission in beirut, when his partner and best friend, detective nordberg is gunned down in a undercover operation. frank's investigation into nordberg's attempted murder leads frank to become suspicious of well-respected businessman vincent ludwig, and discovers ludwig plans to brainwash a baseball player with mind controlling device, and assassinate queen elizabeth ii, who is visiting los angeles on her american tour.
